A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The final third of \"The Last Jedi\" is what saves it from being a disappointment. I feel the first two-thirds of the movie suffer from major pacing issues. This is primarily due to a subplot that is way out of place and is not in the least bit compelling. Those who have seen the film likely know what I am referring to. However\, as a whole\, this is a solid movie that I\, as a huge \"Star Wars\" fan\, thoroughly enjoyed. Most of the action scenes are tension-filled and a lot of fun and the movie has an emotional center. There are twists and turns the whole way through and I don't think there is another movie in this series I can compare it to\, so I give it many props for being something different. All members of the cast do a good job as far as performances go. They go directions with certain characters that are a bit unpredictable but it mostly works. The movie is also a visual treat and showcases some stellar effects and great directing. I did find myself checking my watch in certain parts in the first half\, and I was upset at this at first\, but the movie wraps up very nicely. There have been better movies in this series before\, but there also have been worse. It's a solid addition that personally has me very excited about what's to come in the next part. Ultimately is a very good movie that falls short of being great due to some storytelling choices.
